chargeHist.descr: Battery to School District Officers, etc
Battery to School District Officers, etc

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges, fees, and assessments over period of probation. Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
- Seek/maintain full-time employment or verify scholl enrollment.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF PROBATION, INCLUDING PAYMENT OF ALL COSTS, COURT FINDS EXPUNGEMENT APPROPRIATE

- Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Take all prescribed medications.
- Letter of apology to victim.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler Joseph Gerszewski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Jack T Eichorst for Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files an AMENDED INFORMATION.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading and plead not guilty.
COUNTS 1 & 2:  Dismissed and read-in

COUNT 3:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 5 days days time served.  STAYED and placed on probation for 18 months

Terms of Probation:
-Cooperate with the Department and any treatment deemed appropriate
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Seek / Maintain full time employment or verify school enrollment
-Take all prescribed medications
-Community Service:  25 hours
-Letter of apology to victim 
-Provide DNA sample

The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges, fees, and assessments over period of probation.  Upon successful completion or revocation, any balance remaining unpaid is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
********
Upon successful completion of probation, including payment of all costs, court finds expungement appropriate.  kmw

Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court authorizes transfer to Branch 34 for global resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 34.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of Franklin Detective J.Hintz   Court took Judical Notice 22CF432. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Jaspen to be appointed to this matter. Attorney Jaspen is not available for the next date as set for 4/20/2022. Next date will be 5/16/2022 at 1:30pm. Parties are notified.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4-08-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAN.

Defendant Tyler Joseph Gerszewski in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/6/22 @ 2:30p
